content:
460 
 
  
COURSE/DEGREE AWARDING 
INSTITUTIONS  
REQUIREMENTS    
UTME SUBJECTS  
SPECIAL CONSIDERATION (WAIVER) REMARKS  
DIRECT ENTRY  UTME  
    and any three (3) of the following subjects: Economics,  
History, Commerce, Financial Accounting, 
Typewriting, Government, Geography, Physics and 
Chemistry  
(iv) BENIN accepts Commerce in lieu of Economics.  
(v) BAUCHI requires five (5)'O' level credit passes in 
English Language, Mathematics, Economics/Social 
Studies and any two (2) subjects.  
(vi) TASUED requires five 'O' level credit passes at one (1) 
sitting or six (6) 'O' level credit passes at two (2) sittings 
in English Language, Mathematics and any other three 
(3) subjects in the Social Sciences or Arts which must 
include Economics.  
(vii) NDU requires five (5) ‘O’ level credit passes in English 
Language, Mathematics, and any three (3) of Principles 
of Accounts, Commerce/Economics,  
Insurance, Store Keeping/Management, Word 
Processing, including any one (1) of the Social Sciences 
at not more than two (2) sittings.  
(viii) IAUED– Same as in Accounting Education.  
(ix) LASU accepts any one (1) of Business Methods, 
Principles of Account, Book Keeping or Commerce.  
(x) KWASU requires five (5) 'O’ level credit passes to 
include English Language, Ma thematics plus any one 
(1) of Economics, Commerce, Financial Accounting, 
Typewriting plus any two (2) other Social Science 
subjects.  
(xi) LAGOS accepts five (5) 'O’ level credit passes inEnglish 
Language, Mathematics, Economics and two (2) 
subjects from the Ar ts or the Social Sciences, Data 
Processing/Office Practice, Financial Accounting.  
  
UTME SUBJECTS  
(i) DELSU accepts any three (3) subjects  
(ii) TASUED and BENIN require Mathematics, Economics 
and any other subject in the Arts or the Social 
Sciences.
